Recipe.Description:
A torte is a cake made from mealed nuts, instead of flour.

This can be a challenging recipe, as you can't tell by the usual means when the cake is fully baked, so an accurate oven temperature is important and baking to the required time. If you are using a convection oven that doesn't automatically auto-adjust, reduce the baking temperature by 25 degrees.

For best results, use the freshest eggs you can get and a stand mixer is a must.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Set pan of water to boil.

Ingredient.Name: Nuts
Ingredient.Notes: You choose: Pecans, walnuts, almonds, pistachios.

Method.Step: Using a mixer, cream butter and sugar at low speed for a minute, then at high until light and creamy.
Scrape down bowl and beater and resume mixing.
To the butter and sugar mixture add in egg yolks, one at a time.
Scrape down bowl and beater and resume mixing to achieve a satin consistency.
Transfer mixture to another bowl and clean mixing bowl thoroughly.
Fold nuts and chocolate into the sugar, butter and egg mixture with a spatula, working the mixture as little as possible.
Using a wire whisk attachment on the stand mixer, Whip egg whites until light and stiff.
Gently fold 1/3 of egg whites into first mixture to make it easier to work.
Gently fold in remaining egg whites, again working the mixture as little as possible.
Set cake pan in a shallow roasting pan (or oven safe skillet) then add boiling water to the roasting pan until it reaches the halfway up the cake pan.
Bake at 400 degrees for 45 - 50 minutes, until top of cake is firm to the touch.
Remove from oven, allow to cool, in the pan, for 15 minutes.
Turn out onto a plate, cover and chill.
